page.title: 18St Annes -Places of Interest
page.content: One of the few listed buildings in St Annes is the St Annes Hotel,built 1875 and noted for its stained glass windows (Permission is being sought to demolish this and develop the area,to include a multi_million pound shopping and carpark complex). The Carnegie Library was opened in 1905 and cost Â£3,700. The promenade gardens with interesting items of Edwardian street furniture,lovely examples of decorative pebble pavements near the waterfall and the drinking fountain. The monument to the loss of the 13 crew members of the St Annes Lifeboat'Laura Jane' who perished with 14 lifeboatmen from Southport in December 1886,leaving 16 widows and 50 orphans whilst going to the rescue of the German barque 'Mexico' in the River Ribble.
